title: Unit 2: the Forecast is always wrong, Video 1: Cost Estimates

media:group.media:title: Unit 2: the Forecast is always wrong, Video 1: Cost Estimates
media:group.media:description:
MIT IDS.333 Risk and Decision Analysis, Fall 2021
Instructor: Richard de Neufville
View the complete course: https://ocw.mit.edu/courses/ids-333-risk-and-decision-analysis-fall-2021/
YouTube Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLUl4u3cNGP62jwhTqp8_1kwrkDkxZhpQC

This is the first part of the discussion of why we must expect that forecasts are 'always' wrong. It presents a series of examples of historical cost estimates to illustrate the point.

* NOTE: The following videos serve as pre-class assignments in each unit (no videos for units 1, 3, and 6).
